title: How Conflicts Begin
description: Explore how disagreements typically start between you

questions.text: When my partner brings up a concern, it usually feels approachable.

therapeutic.rationale: How concerns are raised determines how conversations go. Soft, approachable openings invite dialogue; harsh startups trigger defensiveness before real conversation begins.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't find the other's approach approachable, specific feedback helps. What would make it easier to hear?
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual sense of approachable openings creates space for addressing real issues.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does your partner typically bring up concerns? How does that feel?

questions.text: I try to bring up issues in a way my partner can hear.

therapeutic.rationale: Considering how your partner receives information shows care for the relationship, not just the issue. Tailoring your approach increases the chance of being heard.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different self-perceptions here are revealing. One partner may think they're gentle while the other experiences them as harsh. Check the landing, not the intention.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual effort to be hearable creates constructive conflict.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you try to make issues easier for your partner to hear?

questions.text: Our disagreements don't usually start with blame or criticism.

therapeutic.rationale: Blame and criticism at the start put partners on defense immediately. Starting with feelings and needs rather than accusations keeps conversation productive.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner experiences blame at startup, explore what's happening. The other may not realize how their words land. Reframing 'you always' to 'I feel' helps.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared avoidance of blaming startups allows real issues to be discussed.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do your disagreements typically begin? What sets the tone?

questions.text: I can raise something difficult without it immediately escalating.

therapeutic.rationale: When raising issues leads to immediate escalation, partners stop raising issuesâ€”and problems fester. Being able to broach difficult topics calmly is essential.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If topics escalate quickly for one partner, explore what triggers the escalation. Is it the topic? The timing? The approach? Breaking the pattern requires understanding it.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared ability to raise difficult topics calmly creates a safe relationship environment.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What topics tend to escalate quickly? What would help them stay calm?

questions.text: The way we start difficult conversations gives us a good chance of resolving them.

therapeutic.rationale: Research shows conversations end the way they begin 96% of the time. Good startups create resolution; harsh startups create more conflict. The beginning matters enormously.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel optimistic about how conversations start, explore what would improve the opening. Timing? Tone? Framing?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared confidence in your conversation startups predicts successful resolution.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What makes for a good start to difficult conversations between you?
